Hi friends,

Spring 2017 is in full swing! We just had our first E-Board meeting of the semester, and are hard at work recruiting new members (apply at http://bit.ly/2j7bIKn). Stay tuned for our next newsletter, where we will announce some of the awesome things we have planned this semester. We know you will like what's in store!

When: January 30, 2017

Where:
NYU Tandon School of Engineering
6 Metrotech Ctr
Brooklyn, NY 11201

Time: 6:30-9pm

InnoVention is a prototyping competition hosted by EIA that grants 3 winners with $55k in cash prizes, free incorporation with Lowenstein Sandler LLP and credits with AWS, Pipedrive and Rackspace! Students go through weekly workshops, mentor meetings, and 3 rounds of pitching to claim the awesome prizes!

Take 5 minutes to fill out this form (http://bit.ly/team-hunt-2-fb) if you're looking to find teammates or join a team! While teams must have at least one current NYU student, everybody is invited to this event!

Past winners have went on to further build their companies and have raised a total of to $11.6 Million. Will you be joining them?

Watch the video:http://bit.ly/iv17vid
Learn more: http://engineering.nyu.edu/innovention
Apply: http://bit.ly/iv17apply

When: January 31, 2017

Where:
LaGuardia Co-op Collaboration Space
539 LaGuardia Pl
New York , NY 10012

Time: 5pm

PRINT3D's general club meeting will formally introduce 3D printing, as well as go over its events for the semester. Food will be served!

Learn more at https://www.facebook.com/groups/433407386746008/.

Tech@NYU is NYC’s largest student-run organization of hackers, designers & builders. Founded in 2009 by Trevor Owens, the group hosts tech events with the purpose of uniting students and helping them make stuff.

Since its inception it has developed an audience of over 4,000 tech enthusiasts, established consistent tech education franchises (Demo Days, Hack Days, After Hours and Design Days) and generated a social media following of over 10,000 people.
